contentrichtext.text: {{Unreferenced|date=December 2009}} {{Nihongo|'''Goka'''|五箇村|Goka-mura}} was a [[villages of Japan|village]] located in [[Oki District, Shimane|Oki District]], [[Shimane Prefecture|Shimane]], [[Japan]]. On October 1, 2004 Goka was merged the town of [[Saigō, Shimane|Saigō]], and the villages of [[Fuse, Shimane|Fuse]] and [[Tsuma, Shimane|Tsuma]], all from [[Oki District, Shimane|Oki District]], to form the new town of [[Okinoshima, Shimane|Okinoshima]]. As of 2003, the village had an estimated [[population]] of 2,123 and a [[population density|density]] of 40.52 persons per km². The total area was 52.39 km². [[Category:Dissolved municipalities of Shimane Prefecture]] {{Shimane-geo-stub}}
